comments.author: av8rjeff
comments.body: Cool...will be fun to watch this one.  GLWRA

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: if it helps - I will volunteer to re-ship for any international buyers - DaveF, if ok with that can ship to me and I will reship. Again - only if both seller and buyer agree.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: I have one of these as well in an ICG slab. You can see from the angle that the coin is sorta falling out of it's insert/rubber coin holder on one side.FWIW, mine has the same issue. I guess they slabbed it a bit too loose in the size of the rubber insert. I think PT was worth a bit more at the time these sold, but I can't recall exactly. GL, I like the format, it's interesting/different....watching...

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Watching. How many of these are out there? Are there ANY other platinum crypto collectibles along this wonderful rarity?Good luck with the auction, reverse is a cool idea.@owl: True, Platinum didn't appreciate in value like gold did, but still it's probably the only Bitcoin themed collectible made of platinum.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.created_time: May 29, 2023, 11:06:17 AMLast edit: May 29, 2023, 11:33:25 AM by DaveF
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on May 29, 2023, 09:30:06 AMWatching. How many of these are out there? According to the link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4731555.0 there are 70 of them. No idea how many still exist, i'm assuming most but obviously can't prove anything. Using the date from the ann thread BTC was between $7000 to $8000. So, using today's BTC price I am asking for about a 3.25 to 3.5x premium on it. BUT looking at what other things sell for it's not that out of line.The 2019 was cancelled. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5183424 So unless there is some other oddball one out there this is it for PT coins.Quote from: owlcatz on May 29, 2023, 02:15:51 AMI have one of these as well in an ICG slab. You can see from the angle that the coin is sorta falling out of it's insert/rubber coin holder on one side.FWIW, mine has the same issue. I guess they slabbed it a bit too loose in the size of the rubber insert. I think PT was worth a bit more at the time these sold, but I can't recall exactly. GL, I like the format, it's interesting/different....watching...  Mind if I ask what yours was graded at?And yeah, I think they used the gold insert and since platinum is 10% heavier then gold it's loose since it's 10% smaller -Dave

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: DaveF on May 29, 2023, 11:06:17 AMMind if I ask what yours was graded at?And yeah, I think they used the gold insert and since platinum is 10% heavier then gold it's loose. -DaveMine is a PR69 DCAM ... And yeah that would make sense about the loose insert, thanks.

comments.body: Bump and price drop to BTC0.0600-Dave

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Bump and price drop to BTC0.0475Figured by now someone would have grabbed it, yes .0475 is a fair amount of money, but for a rare collectable like this I figured it would been sold.Kind of interesting, wonder what the true pain price is for collectables and people not wanting to spend more then a certain amount on them.Or is it just people don't want to part with their BTC?-Dave

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Quote from: DaveF on July 31, 2023, 11:35:47 AMBump and price drop to BTC0.0475Figured by now someone would have grabbed it, yes .0475 is a fair amount of money, but for a rare collectable like this I figured it would been sold.Kind of interesting, wonder what the true pain price is for collectables and people not wanting to spend more then a certain amount on them.Or is it just people don't want to part with their BTC?-DaveAh, forum sales are dead for the most part. I noticed this a while ago, but thought it would have recovered by now. Not the case but it will happen eventually.Have you tried putting it on scarce.city - not sure if they offer a normal sale option that's not an auction, though.I already got one of these, otherwise I'd be pretty tempted with a first (and only one) platinum collectible.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Bump and price drop to BTC0.045Fall is here and the car shows where I was spending time to move that stuff is coming to an end, so time to move more crypto items.Will keep moving things out bit more, depending on my free time. -Dave

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Forgot I never sold this.So now it's just a flat $1000 shipped anywhere in the USA.BTC / LTC / ETH / some other coins can be discussed. Pack up one thing and find 2 more things under it.....-Dave

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: For reference, there were only 70 of these coins mintedGood luck with your sale

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: watching as I also have one for sale.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on June 24, 2024, 02:42:57 PMwatching as I also have one for sale.You price is lower then mine, but it is a 64 vs a 68.Makes you wonder as collectors are people who do collect the crypto stuff as picky as those doing other sorts of coin collecting.Guess it's a good test since we can see which one sells 1st.Unlike a lot of other coins we do know how many of these crypro collectables are out there so it's a bit different then the 1932 Quarter that people only have a general idea of how many made it to today.-Dave

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Dropped price to $850.Still not sure of what a fair price really is, but since I am in no rush to sell it I will just keep dropping the price here and there until it sells.Is it me or are higher priced collectables just not moving the way they used to?-Dave

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: DaveF on August 28, 2024, 02:26:05 PMIs it me or are higher priced collectables just not moving the way they used to?-DaveI wouldn't go that far.  I think the main problem with these collectables is that they are not in any way connected to Bitcoin outside of the brand name and the brand has taken a bit of a black eye lately.  With that considered, a lot of people are probably looking at the spot value of this item which is below $240.  So I can understand why this might be a tough sell.  However, I'm sure there are still people who like the brand and collect them, so the right collector looking for a deal is probably watching and waiting to strike.  Good luck!

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on August 28, 2024, 10:16:57 PMQuote from: DaveF on August 28, 2024, 02:26:05 PMIs it me or are higher priced collectables just not moving the way they used to?-DaveI wouldn't go that far.  I think the main problem with these collectables is that they are not in any way connected to Bitcoin outside of the brand name and the brand has taken a bit of a black eye lately.  With that considered, a lot of people are probably looking at the spot value of this item which is below $240.  So I can understand why this might be a tough sell.  However, I'm sure there are still people who like the brand and collect them, so the right collector looking for a deal is probably watching and waiting to strike.  Good luck!Yes, with a but. If you look at the last auction I did: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5505172 or the one I have up now https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5507494 there is / was very little interest. MJ has had a couple up too for higher value loaded pieces that have not moved.Not that big a deal to me, they will sell when they sell it just feels to me that things like this used to move quicker.-Dave

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Moved some stuff and saw this on the shelf again after 5+ weeks.Dropping the price to $650 shipped US.Sooner or later someone is going to take it :-)-Dave
